    • firstFillBoard

      public void firstFillBoard(int numPlayers, GameRules gameRules) throws Exception
      Fills the board initially with tiles based on the number of players and game rules.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - The number of players.
      gameRules - Used to read the game rules from a JSON file. It provides the rules and settings for the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the reading of game rules from the JSON file.

    • fillBag

      public void fillBag(GameRules gameRules)
      Fills the bag with item tiles based on the specified game rules.
      Parameters:
      gameRules - Used to read the game rules from a JSON file. It provides the rules and settings for the game.

    • setFreeEdges

      public void setFreeEdges(int x, int y)
      Calculates the number of free edges of the cell having x and y coordinates of the Board.
      Parameters:
      x - :board.matrix row
      y - : board.matrix column

    • increaseNear

      public void increaseNear(int x, int y)
      Updates the free edges of the adjacent cells after the tile in row x and column y of the board is chosen by the user.
      Parameters:
      x - :board.matrix row
      y - : board.matrix column

    • allAdjacent

      public boolean allAdjacent(int[] coordinatesSelected)
      Checks if all the specified coordinates are adjacent to each other.
      Parameters:
      coordinatesSelected - The array of coordinates to be checked. The coordinates should be in the format [x1, y1, x2, y2, ..., xn, yn].
      Returns:
      True if all the coordinates are adjacent to each other, false otherwise.

    • allSameRowOrSameColumn

      public boolean allSameRowOrSameColumn(int[] coordinatesSelected)
      Checks if all the specified coordinates are in the same row or the same column.
      Parameters:
      coordinatesSelected - The array of coordinates to be checked. The coordinates should be in the format [x1, y1, x2, y2, ..., xn, yn].
      Returns:
      True if all the coordinates are in the same row or the same column, false otherwise.

    • checkCoordinates

      public ErrorType checkCoordinates(int x, int y)
      Checks if the specified coordinates are valid and if there is any error associated with them.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate.
      y - The y-coordinate.
      Returns:
      The error type associated with the coordinates, or null if the coordinates are valid.

    • checkError

      public boolean checkError(ErrorType error)
      Checks if the specified error type indicates an error.
      Parameters:
      error - The error type to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if the error type indicates an error, false otherwise.

    • checkSelectable

      public ErrorType checkSelectable(int[] selection, int maxSelectableTile) throws Error
      Checks if the specified selection is selectable and adds the corresponding BoardBox to the selectedBoard list.
      Parameters:
      selection - The array of selection coordinates.
      maxSelectableTile - The maximum number of selectable tiles, which can vary depending on the occupancy of the bookshelf.
      Returns:
      The error type associated with the selection, or null if the selection is selectable.
      Throws:
      Error

    • selected

      public ArrayList<ItemTile> selected()
      Retrieves the list of selected ItemTiles from the selectedBoard.
      Returns:
      The list of selected ItemTiles.

    • changeBoardAfterUserChoice

      public void changeBoardAfterUserChoice()
      Resets the board by clearing the selected tiles and updating the neighboring cells. The neighboring cells of the selected tiles have their attributes modified accordingly. After resetting, the board view in the model is updated to reflect the changes.

    • checkRefill

      public boolean checkRefill()
      Checks if there are any isolated cells on the board.
      Returns:
      true if there are only isolated cells, false otherwise.

    • refill

      public void refill()
      Refills the board by adding isolated tiles to the occupiable cells. The method performs the following steps: 1)Collects all the isolated tiles and adds them to the ArrayList. 2)Randomly extracts tiles from the ArrayList. 3)Inserts the extracted tiles onto the board in correspondence with the occupiable cells.
